tests.expected: A list of tags that you currently have, and the tag limit on you.
Relevant information to render your profile page, including name, username, URL to profile image, list of tags, etc.

tests.setup: Prepare the names of tags in existence. You can do so by searching for tags in the profile setup page.
tests.javascript: fetch('profile/add_tags', postRequestContent({ count: 1, tags: ['Artificial Intelligence'] })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response))
tests.expected: Success (in console). Redirecting to your profile to see your 'Artificial Intelligence' tag added to your profile.

tests.setup: Execute the first line of code into the console. Upon pop up, choose a picture (if you choose a file that is not a picture, server will respond with 400). After that, execute the second line of code in the console.
tests.javascript:
const input = document.createElement('input'); input.type = 'file'; input.click();

fetch('/profile/set_profile_image', postRequestContent({ img: input.files[0] })).then(response => response.text()).then(response => console.log(response))
tests.expected: Success (in console). Redirecting to your profile to see your new profile picture.

tests.setup: You may paste '<host>/profile/img/<username>' into the URL bar to view the profile image of the user with the specified username.
tests.expected: The profile image of the user with the given username

tests.setup: Replace the query parameter with an actual query string
tests.expected: The list of tags that have the query parameter as substring of their names

tests.setup: Replace the tag name with the name of a tag. This tag must exist. You may paste '<host>/profile/tag/<tag_name>' into the URL bar to view the image.
tests.expected: The icon of the tag with the specified tag name.

tests.setup: Replace the username with the username of an existing user.
tests.expected: The list of tags of the user with provided username.
